case_vignette: A 17-YEAR-OLD MALE PRESENTS WITH A SEVERAL YEAR HISTORY OF A SPOT ON THE NECK THAT DEVELOPED ACUTE ONSET PAIN FOR THE PAST 3 DAYS AND WARMTH. ON EXAMINATION ALONG THE LEFT LATERAL NECK IS A TENDER, SOFT SKIN COLORED NODULE. BIOPSY IS PERFORMED AND REVEALS STRATIFIED SQUAMOUS EPITHELIUM WITH SURROUNDING LYMPHOID TISSUE.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painful and warm spot on my neck that has been there for several years but started hurting acutely over the last 3 days.
Has the appearance of the spot changed recently or has it remained constant over the years?
It has remained constant over the years.
Have you experienced any fever or other systemic symptoms recently?
No, I have not experienced any fever or other systemic symptoms recently.
Do you have any chronic illnesses or are you currently taking any medications?
I have not mentioned any chronic illnesses or medications that I am taking.
Does the spot on your neck have any discharge or is it just red and swollen?
The spot on my neck does not have any discharge; it is just tender and warm.
Is there any history of similar symptoms in your family?
I have not mentioned any family history of similar symptoms.
**Final Diagnosis:** Furuncle (Boil)
